definition: toady/bootlicker
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
fart/flatulence/nonsense/(usu. in the negative) what/(not) a damn thing
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)

sentences.english: He's a little kiss-ass bastard who'll do anything to get ahead.
sentences.chinese: 那个小混蛋是个马屁精，只要能往上爬，他啥事都干。

sentences.english: Every knows that Sammy's the biggest apple-polisher in our company.
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道珊咪是我们公司最大的马屁精。

sentences.english: John is an apple-polisher ------ he always agrees with whatever the boss says.
sentences.chinese: 约翰是个马屁精，不管老板说什么，他都赞同。

sentences.english: Sally: I’m not surprised. He’s such a brown-noser.
sentences.chinese: 我一点都不觉得惊讶，他可是个马屁精。

sentences.english: With a clatter, the flatterer shattered the chattering wattmeter in the chaos.
sentences.chinese: 卖啷一声，马屁精在杂沓中打碎了格格作响的瓦特表。

sentences.english: That guy is a ture bootlicker.
sentences.chinese: 这个家伙真是个马屁精。

sentences.english: When flatterers meet, the devil goes to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 马屁精会面，魔鬼赴赴宴。

sentences.english: Bill is a brown-nose and none of his colleagues likes him in the company.
sentences.chinese: 比尔是个马屁精，公司里没有一个同事喜欢他。

sentences.english: That even its grossest flatterers dare not praise.
sentences.chinese: 最庸俗的马屁精也未敢讨好。

sentences.english: Flatterer, " she said giving him a mock reproving look."
sentences.chinese: “马屁精，”她饱含嘲弄和责备地看了他一眼，说道。

sentences.english: Mary is an apple polisher——she can even handle illegal documents for the boss.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽是个马屁精，她甚至可以为老板处理非文件。

sentences.english: He was promoted very quickly because he is a real apple polisher.
sentences.chinese: 他升职升得很快，因为他是一个十足的马屁精。

sentences.english: I began to argue with the metaphysical sycophants
sentences.chinese: 我开始和这些形而上学的马屁精争论。

sentences.english: When flatterers meet, the devil goes to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 马屁精会面，魔鬼去赴宴。

sentences.english: With a clatter, the flatterer shattered the chattering wattmeter in the chaos.
sentences.chinese: 当啷一声，马屁精在混乱中打碎了格格作响的瓦特表。

definition: to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to resort to bragging and flattering
to flatter/to toady
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
(derog.) inept advisor/a good-for-nothing adviser/one who offers bad advice
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
unable to accomplish anything but liable to spoil everything (idiom)/unable to do anything right/never make, but always mar
pinyin: cheng2 shi4 bu4 zu2 , bai4 shi4 you3 yu2

definition: horse hindquarters/flattery/boot-licking
snob
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
megalomania/egomania/delusions of grandeur
